title: Influence Sphere Schema
description: Standardized enumeration of domains where organizations may exert power or control in The Shadow Team Chronicles universe.

descriptions.description: Detailed explanations of each influence sphere (not part of the enum, provided for documentation)

economic.description: Influence over markets, commerce, trade, or financial systems.

political.description: Power within governance structures, policy-making, or electoral processes.

military.description: Control over armed forces, security operations, or capacity for organized violence.

technological.description: Authority in development, distribution, or standards of technological systems.

social.description: Ability to shape interpersonal dynamics, class structures, or community relations.

religious.description: Power within spiritual practices, theological interpretation, or faith communities.

cultural.description: Influence over arts, entertainment, traditions, language, or collective identity.

criminal.description: Control of illicit activities, underground economies, or extralegal power structures.

media.description: Authority over information channels, news distribution, or narrative framing.

academic.description: Power within educational institutions, research priorities, or knowledge validation.

intelligence.description: Control over information gathering, surveillance, or covert operations capabilities.

environmental.description: Influence over natural resources, ecological policies, or environmental management.

magical.description: Authority over supernatural forces, arcane knowledge, or mystical practices.

infrastructure.description: Control of physical systems like roads, utilities, communications networks, or public facilities.

healthcare.description: Power within medical systems, treatment protocols, pharmaceutical development, or healthcare access.

legal.description: Influence over laws, regulations, enforcement, or judicial proceedings.

digital.description: Authority within virtual spaces, digital platforms, online communities, or data systems.

entertainment.description: Control over recreational activities, venues, performances, or leisure industries.

transportation.description: Power over movement systems including shipping, transit, vehicle production, or travel networks.

energy.description: Influence over power generation, fuel sources, distribution systems, or energy policies.

food_supply.description: Control of agricultural production, food processing, distribution networks, or nutritional standards.

real_estate.description: Authority over land ownership, property development, housing, or spatial organization.

financial.description: Power within banking systems, investment networks, monetary policy, or wealth management.

manufacturing.description: Influence over production processes, industrial capacity, supply chains, or material goods.

educational.description: Control of learning institutions, curriculum development, training programs, or certification systems.
